review: Came for dinner at around six o'clock and the place was relatively empty. When we sat down our waiter came straight over and took our drink order, when he came back with the drinks we were ready to order. I ordered the Santa Fe Bowl (summer menu) and my wife ordered the wild mushrooms pasta (new menu item). I really enjoyed the Santa Fe bowl it was really fresh and light. Every ingredient put together blended well together from the toasted pepitas to the ranch poblano sauce. My wife loved her pasta dish it was just the right amount and was perfectly cooked!! The service was excellent, every time our drinks were low the waiter would have a new one ready! My only negative about the place is when you have carpet in a restaurant the amount of foot traffic it takes leaves a weird carpet smell in the restaurant.  Other then that everything was excellent. Definitely will be coming back.

CPK ..... mediocre food and pizza it's good if your at the mall and there's no where else to eat when you just want a quick bite and drink.  Apps are okay... i make better spinach and artichoke dip.  Our margherita pizza wasn't that great, not enough seasoning and the bottom was soggy.  The salad had like fake ingredients .. fake hard boiled egg and weird looking bacon and chicken.  I don't think i'll be back ....

I have been here before. There are so many food and drink options. I had a red berry sangria. It was light and sweet and was made perfect. I ordered the flat bread chicken margherita pizza. It had tomatoes, mozzarella, basil and Parmesan cheese on it. The flatbread was crispy and it was very tasty. Overall every time I come here I enjoy every meal.
I love the food at CPK. The service at this one isn't the best though. No one greeted my party at the door. They're slow and not very accommodating.

I really enjoyed their Thai chicken pizza before and came here after awhile of not eating here. The pizza didn't taste that bad but it was super skimpy on all the toppings and very dry. It was all dough. I also got the Mac and cheese appetizers and def avoid these, they were also bland dry and completely unappetizing. Big disappointment tonight. It was a big waste of money.

I wasn't too hungry when I went to this restaurant with my friends so I only ordered an appetizer. I got the popular Avocado club egg rolls which were pretty good. I liked of the avocado and cheese and chicken but the crust of the egg roll was oily and too crunchy. Marvin got a pasta dish that he enjoyed, I tried a bite and it was alright but nothing special. The service was average, I prefer to get pasta and pizza elsewhere.

The pizza is sooooo good! And you have to try some of their cold beverage. The only reason giving 4 stars is they have the worse lamb, check the pics I upload, recommend change to new clean lamb, will be so much better!
I got the spicy chicken (half) sandwich with the quinoa salad. It was more that what I expected (first time here). I'll 100% return, can't wait to try new dishes.

I came here with 6 17 year olds and my wife.  2 separate tables. Seems the younger folks like the pizza and pasta here. I ordered the Chicken Milanese.  It is the worst piece of chicken I've had in my life.  Over cooked, over seasoned hockey puck. I eat out almost 100 times per year for business so my frame of reference is wide. I pushed it aside and did not touch it! Bad night I suppose!

As high school students living in a college environment for a prolonged period of time, we were expecting a food delivery similar to that of the west coast. I supposed we were incorrect in assuming that, as the delivery did not know location, and the pizza for my vegan friend (margharita, no cheese) ended up simply being a piece of dough with sauce on the top. A waste of money, but as we are desperate for west coast best coast food, we will potentially order here again. (Everything else was fine)

They had a lot of interesting choices for meal options and appetizer choices. My boyfriend and I tried the spicy buffalo cauliflower for the first time yesterday and omg was it delicious. I've been hearing about it from different sources and was dying to try it. The rest of the appetizer choices were also types that you won't find at most other places which can be a good thing or bad thing depending what you're in the mood for. My boyfriend typically tries their pasta dishes each time we go and never fails to be disappointed. I prefer trying out their diff flavors of pizza since they are called California Pizza Kitchen for a reason. I tried the Original BBQ Chicken pizza last time and was not a huge fan. It had good flavor and i love pineapples on my pizza but the BBQ sauce made the dough super mushy. Yesterday I tried the spinach and artichoke thin crust pizza and was much more satisfied. Amazing flavor and the thin crust is crispier which prevented it from any mush. Definitely recommend trying this place out!
Great food with lovely waiters, the restaurant is great, the food came to the table fast and tastes really good. Definitely recommend for a nice casual setting.

I hate writing reviews for lousy meals but boy was this just so underwhelming that I feel that I need to do my due diligence as a Yelper & give an honest review. Came for lunch today since the Cheesecake Factory had a 45 minute wait and we weren't in the mood for Bobby's Burger Palace. Now I realize we should've had BBP instead of CPK. First of all we must've stood waiting for a table for an empty restaurant for at least 3-5 minutes. I mean plenty of employees around just it seemed like no one wanted to seat us. We finally got seated and it took a few more minutes to get greeted by our waiter. We decided we'd get the following: - Avocado Egg Rolls: which we used to love and they were just OK. - Tostada Pizza: which states that it's a crispy thin crust. This was more like a limp thin crust. Sorry this was just blah. It seemed like maybe one of the managers or cooks came around and asked us how our meal was. When we mentioned how the pizza was rather flimsy she asked if we wanted another one and we opted not to. Only to reply back to us with to order it more well done next time. How about no? It states it's a crispy thin crust and therefore it should be crispy without me having to specify that it should be more well done. Our server was nice but didn't bother to ask us how everything was. Maybe he could tell we were aggravated and just didn't add gas to the fire. Sorry CPK... but I don't think we'll ever be back after this. You used to be awesome with the potato salad, the egg rolls, and the spinach dip. Even the key lime pie used to be amazing!!! But now not so much. If I want chain pizza I rather hit up Blaze Fast Fire'd or Anthony's Coal Fired Pizza. Skip!
The service was goood but the food was undercooked and dry,I ordered the chicken garlic parmesan.

Consistently good. Clean and nice decor. Servers are always friendly and work hard to accommodate any size party, large or small. They are very attentive as well. I've yet to have a bad meal here. CPKs menu changes over time and new additions are just as tasty as old ones. Recommend!

Came here for dinner the other night not knowing what to expect . You don't necessarily think of pizza when you think of California but it wasn't too bad. My girlfriend loves this place and suggested it . The ambience is quite nice. We ordered the avocado egg rolls as an appetizer which had tomatoes and chicken in it. It was a little too greasy but the flavor was good. I ordered the roasted garlic chicken pizza which was pretty good. It had caramelized onions, mozzarella, grilled chicken and of course garlic. I was pleased with my meal . In my opinion, the menu was a little overpriced for the pizza. The personal pies which are equivalent to around 2 slices are between 12-16 dollars. They have a variety of slices though. Overall i was pleased and if I could add an extra half star I would.
My friend and I ordered delivery through the phone. After waiting over an hour, we called them and they said the order never went through. It took over two hours to get our food.

Food was good. I had a pepperoni and sausage pizza and my boyfriend had the mushroom with truffle oil pizza. The waiter wasn't really attentive. He would disappear often where we couldn't flag him down if we needed him. We sat around and waited for a while especially after he handed us the dessert menu. I would go back but just hope we had a more attentive waiter next time.

I wish I could give these guys Zero stars. Unprofessional the second I walked in. The host was too busy chatting up two of his co-workers by the bar instead of helping me to a table. Very rude. Will never come back here again

I have to say, with a name like California Pizza Kitchen, one would order pizza; not this guy.  I got the club sandwich and this was to die for!  Fresh avocado, turkey, bacon, lettuce, and fresh veggies!  The service was great as we were seated right away.  Our server was training a new waitress, but he still was able to teach and serve us well.  He also gave a great recommendation of a Pinot to accompany my meal.
When ever you order something they always make it the same way.  I like this.  MaiTai is my favorite

This California Pizza Kitchen is like a random black sheep of the chain...and I have no idea why. This place is literally never ever ever ever full. You can go in on a Friday night at 6, or Saturday at lunch, it doesn't matter. My mom loves CPK, so we find ourselves frequenting this one often mainly because....well there's a wait in other places. Anytime we know we can't wait, and just want some good food, we come here. Their food is always consistently good, and I have actually never really had a bad CPK experience here. Seating is fast (lol), food comes out quick, good servers, etc. What I got a few weeks ago and really really enjoyed: -the dumpling appetizer -the thai crunch salad - if you like salads, this one is one of the best I've had -the salted caramel pudding dessert - OMG. serious. for serious. I literally said OMG when tasting it.  So, if you're in the area, want good CPK food at a good price, and need to get in and get out, come here! It's a staple for me, and I'm personally extremely glad it's never that busy. Just hope it doesn't shut down anytime soon!

I used to like this place...the bbq chicken pizza looked like the bbq chicken was smeared on.  The dishes were sticky and the water glass smelled of bleach.  Time to avoid this place and wait to see what comes into the location next.  Manager at front desk didn't even say good bye.  Too busy doing nothing to help open a door for an elderly trying to go out.

This place is awesome. Glad I took the chance. We had the white pizza with the guacamole dip. The dip was fresh and very tasty. I even put some of the dip on my pizza. Wow! It was good. The white pizza with some of that dip on it is amazing. Got great service from a server named Michael. I will definitely be going back. The outside seating was nice too.
The Greek Salad Pizza was taken off the menu!!! I now have no reason to spend money at CPK.

I went here last night with my girlfriend for dinner. She had never been here before, but I have been many times. When we got there we quickly seated and had our drink orders taken, which then came out fast. After deciding on what we were ordering we received our appetizer in a very timely fashion (we ordered the ginger chicken dumplings, which were fantastic), and the thin crust pizza we ordered came out relatively fast as well (Jamaican Jerk Chicken pizza). The pizza was very well done, not undercooked, good seasonings. We then split a chocolate souffle which came out faster than the pizza and dumplings. All in all the dinner was great and the prices were very fair for their portions. I highly recommend it.

Went here for the first time tonight. Not a bad place to eat if you're looking for some tasty pizza. LOCATION: Nice location, next to the mall so you can do some shopping after you eat. DECOR: Cute decor, very casual but at the same time neat and clean. Soft lighting. FOOD/DRINK: I ordered a BBQ Chicken pizza which was pretty tasty. It was around $13, kind of pricey considering the pizza was very small. It definitely was filling though if your eating just 1 pizza to yourself and not sharing. It's definitely not really "authentic" NY, italian pizza but its still pretty good./ I ordered a mango mojito which was $7. It was kinda pricey for that too considering the glas was very small, but it was a delicious drink. SERVICE: Very friendly waitor, helped with my thoughts on what pizza I should order.

We downloaded the app and got a free appetizer the last time we were here, which brought us right back.  There seems to never be a wait, compared to the other restaurants around it.  For appetizers we will ALWAYS order the avocado egg rolls, they are delicious and come out quickly. They serve them with what i believe is a ranch dipping sauce and another sauce that has a little spice to it.  Have tried multiple pizzas and all were great. If you're not in a pizza mood, the four cheese raviloi is amazing and is perfectly portioned. At the end of your meal they also give you a coupon you can't open until the next time you are there to find out how much it is for, which pretty much insures we will be eating here again in the near future. (Not sure how long this promotion will be running for).
I have always had a soft spot for CPK. Everythime I go I get the same thing and it rocks: California Club Pizza on Honey Wheat Dough.

The last time I ate at a CPK was back in May 2013 and at the Huntington location. That was not the best experience and things seemed to have gone South as far as food quality and service. Tonight was a much better experience and CPK earned back some brownie points. It was late, past the normal dinner time rush, the place was pretty empty and we were pressed for time so it was nice to have the food come out rather quickly.  Due to the hour we ate on the light side splitting the classic BBQ chicken chopped salad, Bianco flatbread and Belgian chocolate suffle cake. Everything was really good and wouldn't hesitate to recommend ordering any of the dishes. I've had the BBQ chicken chopped salad many times before but not in a lng time and was reminded of why it's a classic at CPK. First time, but not the last, for both the Bianco flatbread and Belgian chcocolate suffle cake.  This was defintely a nice come back compared to my last visit to the Huntington CPK and they've earned back my business!

heres a tip, if you are considering this place, just dont come.  its overpriced, the food is bad and tastes like it came out the freezer.  the lines are always long for an unknown reasons.  do yourself a favor and try ANY of the other better restarunst inthe area and dont come here

Very fast and expedient service. Ordered quickly, almost too quickly in my opinion. Felt pressured by a waiter who brought us the dessert menu before we were 1/2 done with our pizza. The pizza however was phenomenal. An absolute must is the California Cobb pizza on the whole wheat crust! Delicious!!

I probably won't go back again and I hate to say it because of one bad experience, not only that they are over priced. Anyway we ended up having a seat right near the kitchen doors that weren't closed. It was like 2 in the afternoon and there wasn't a soul in there besides the wait staff. We ordered our food got out appetizer right away and than after we were finished I watched my pizza get set down ready to be taken out and my boyfriends as well, so I got excited and was like oh our food is coming.. Well it didn't, it got so ridiculous to the point where my boyfriend had timed it.. He said our food sat there for over 20 minutes. Even in between that time frame  our waiter came over and asked do you want refills we said yes, and that's when he disappeared. I had gotten the barbecue chicken pizza, which after sitting under a heat lamp for 20 minutes means the red onions are all wilted the pizza was hard to break apart. The waiter could tell I was disappointed and got the manager, so I waited another 20 minutes for them to make me another pizza which I ended up eating one slice due from picking on my boyfriends food who luckily for a cold sandwich.... And than after a disappointing lunch/dinner my boyfriend paid an over priced bill.

Haven't had a bad dining experience like this in a while. I used to come here about a year ago and the place would be packed out and there was always a wait on weekends. To my surprise on a Friday evening at dinner time there was no wait. Sat with a couple other people. The waitress didn't understand any general questions we had about the food. I asked about how a certain dish was served and she was wrong about it. Okay now about what we ordered- the Cobb salad had burnt bacon in it that was so black it looked like a thin piece of charcoal. The lettuce wrap appetizer is one of those "make your own" things. Doesn't say that on the menu. Now I might not mind if I was at some random pub-- but to be at a nice restaurant I don't like having to make my own anything using my hands. The app comes with huge pieces from a head of lettuce that are way too big to fill, impossible to wrap and roll them and messy to eat, the mixture and sauce to fill them with tasted good at first but after eating it for a little was nauseating. The whole thing was very messy and hard to eat. It came with shrimp that were undercooked tiny pieces of garbage shrimp. The waitress asked if we were still working on our plates as we had our forks in hand, chewing a mouthful of food and stood there waiting for a response. Lol just kind of comical. Bad experience altogether and not going back any time soon. One star for the very sweet and friendly hostess that sat us and my second star is for the pretty atmosphere inside.

I love a good slice of pizza. In this place that means a divine personal pizza. I had a great time here. I had the California Club personal pizza . It was absolutely fantastic and addictive. My pie had avocado, lettuce, Mozarella cheese, bacon, and tomatoes. This pie was very creative and tasty!! The Pinot Gricio wine was the final touch. My experience here was a good one. Probably my favorite pizza from a chain restaurant!!

The service is excellent. My server was very friendly and my drink was refilled without me asking. The food came out at a decent pace. I ordered the Sedona tortilla soup. It really warms you up on a cold day. I also ordered the Sicilian thin crust pizza. It was delicious! So much meat and cheese. The crust is the best part, so crunchy!
Oh my god. 3 personal pizzas and an appetizers 100. What and the food was ugh. Nothing special. Non crispy crust. Slow service.  Go to a regular pizzeria and stuff yourself for half the Price

I've always loved the Miso Salad here... I spent the last year abroad where the CPK chains didn't have the Miso Salad, and was looking forward to having it again as soon as I came home... Guess what? The Miso Salad is now off the menu. TT_TT Still, the food is always delicious here. Have had a few problems with getting shrimp instead of chicken on the miso salad, once for takeout and once eating in... I'm extremely allergic to shrimp... still I've eaten here so many times that a few little mistakes are to be expected.

Came here with my family, otherwise I most likely wouldn't have come of my own accord, I usually despise chain restaurants. I don't feel right about giving a chain restaurant more than three stars, but I have to say I was pleasantly surprised with this place, it wasn't that bad. I ordered the Jambalaya and enjoyed it very much. Not to mention our server was really great. So California Pizza Kitchen rises above its contemporaries with 3 1/2 stars.

I knew going into this place that I was going to hate the food. Its a theme restaurant. Its my sister in laws birthday and we all decide to come here for dinner. I look at the menu and they have barfy sounding $13 indivdual pizzas. Thai pizza? Gag me. The pizza in New York City is the best pizza in the entire world, I'm not going to eat pizza in Long Island on the weekends because of places like this with its fake brick oven. I'll save it for when I go into the city. Anyway, I order a $14 salad and my wife orders a Basil pizza so we can split both the salad and pizza. The $14 salad was ok but the pizza? For pizza made in a brick oven it was horrible. It was really doughy and undercooked. I'd rather eat pizza at Cosmos Pizza in Stony Brook and I hate that place. I love Disneyworld, we're going on vacation in August. I'll eat at the theme restaurants then. Pass on this place, its too expensive and not worth the $$ or calories. Save the brick oven pizza making for the professionals in NYC.

Terrible food and terrible service. We ordered the roasted chicken and the chicken was so dry and tasteless. We also ordered the BBQ chicken salad and even that was just so so. Maybe you have to order the pizza here.  Overall, this place is nothing to write home about.

This location is dreary and tired. Dirty, stained carpets, ripped pleather booths, and broken window shades abound. Our waiter had black, filthy fingernails--repulsive as we knew he was handling our food. We watched as a female server in the kitchen put her hair in a ponytail, and without washing her hands re-entered the dining room. Generally, the CPK chain is truly not bad, with the margarita pizza and white bean hummus all being stand outs. Smith Haven Mall CPK, please get it together and deep clean, repair, and sanitize this location!

For a chain restaurant it's not bad. Consistent brick oven pizza.  It's a decent place to eat lunch while shopping at the Smithhaven mall. You know exactly what you are getting.  The service was prompt and friendly.

I come here for one thing and one thing alone: the California Cobb Salad. This thing is massive. It ain't a salad, it's a whole veggie patch. The half-portion is more than enough for two people to split. It's chock full of beets, avocado, boiled egg, tomatoes, cheese and chicken, yum. My mom and sister ALWAYS get the Jamaican Jerk Pizza. It's pretty tasty. This location is pretty solid. We usually come around for lunch, when it's not crowded. We were recently waited on by a pretty nice, friendly male waiter. He was pretty attentive. Like all other eateries, i'm sure that this place gets pretty cray and crowded in the evening. Other than that, great place for lunch!

I'll make this easy. When a New Yorker eats pizza at a chain restaurant (Anthony's is the exception) they get what they deserve. A real shitty pizza. Service - good Bread - excellent Salads - excellent Pizzas - all 3 were shitty.  Guess I got what I deserved.

Visit Date: November 7, 2014 I came here as part of my friend's birthday party. We were a big group but we didn't have to wait to long to be seated. Our waitress was very nice, friendly and helpful to our large group.  For my dinner I chose to have two small plates of food I got a flat bread (which I don't remember the name of) and the crispy mac n'cheese. If I knew the small plates were really going to be small I would have ordered an extra small plate or two.  The flat bread and the crispy mac n' cheese were great. Full of cheese, carbs and creamyness, definitely a plus.  This place is definitely a good place to go if you're around smithhaven, good food, pretty fast service, with a clean and warm atmosphere!

I have always loved CPK. Their walt whitman mall location is much better than their smithhaven mall location, in my opinion. Their appetizers are amazing, ALWAYS get the avacado egg rolls and the sesame dumplings! They are delicious. I used to get the roasted garlic chicken, but they took it off the menu and I stopped going as often. I do love their pies though, they are very delicious and flavorful. Their thai lettuce wraps are delicious too - I prefer them here over the cheesecake factory. The atmosphere is very nice and the staff is professional. Try it!

This place has gotten so dirty. It really needs a cleaning and some upholstery work. The tables are sticky. Salt shakers dirty and booths have tape over the torn seats. This is why there is always a table here. Server was nice and attentive but we won't be back.

So we really like CPK but this locale is getting long in the  tooth.  It needs a redo. Tables are scratched and carved with folks initials.  Several booths have tears in seats.  Last visit two of three pizzas came out a bit scorched.  A couple behind us returned a burned pie.  We will continue or love for CPK. But attention is needed.

Had the dumpling appetizer good start small but 3 of us shared . I was able to sample a beer I was interested in ordering good thing since I wasn't crazy for it good suggestion by our waitress to sample it . Stephanie was a very good waitress she was engaging and making suggestions like she was eating with us . She did a really good job . She brought me a beer I knew I would like our pizzas were good and hot and we traded of course Jamaican jerk,California club, bbq chicken with bacon added . All were good we all enjoyed each other's pizzas no room for dessert . Only complaints my wife's sangria she said was watered down and one of our appetizer plates on the table was dirty with food crust on it yuck . But overall good food and great service

Kids salad is actually not a asalad at all. It's lettuce with gold fish. Does CPK have any other vegetables? You would expect to have tomatoes at the least.  We usually have decent service but tonight we were seated for 20 minute before we saw a waiter or waitress. And, in that time I went to the hostess station and asked a different waitress for help. If you're in the Smithhaven Mall there are plenty of better options.

So we walk in at 415pm on a Sunday. Most of the staff is sitting by the bar tables eating. No hostess. After a minute one employee gets up and seats us. Drink order took forever even though the restaurant is empty. They never brought bread to us and I asked the waitress for some bread cause my daughter was starving. She brings three pieces of bread with a giant blubber of butter in the middle. It was butter with bread. We are waiting for our food when I hear Ken behind the bar talking to a tall waitress about smoking marijuana and blunts.. Like REALLY!!! I mean I'm liberal but these are not conversations for working hours. We've waited now 30 minutes and out pizzas are still not here although line I said.. PLACE IS EMPTY!! Guess management needs to do something about this place, I've been to other ones sand service was great and prompt.. NOT HAPPY!!

Just went inside of this Restaurant. Was greeted by some one who wasn't welcoming. We were seated without one word being spoken to us. Such as: your waiter will be right with you. Sat for 15 min. With out any one saying anything at all to us, Not even to offer us a drink option. So the staff just stood there and watched while we walked out.  Poor service!!!. Will spend Money elsewhere!!

Been here for the first time ever. Ordered the BBQ Chicken pizza. It tasted like soap. They said it was the cilantro. DON'T GET CILANTRO ON YOUR PIZZA.  The bartender Mike P. was awesome! Great service and very knowledgeable. Very cool guy. Look for him.
Better than I thought. Waiter wasn't good but at these corporate restaurants they typically hire anyone and put them to work. Don't expect good pizza just something fresh and light.

CPK used to be one of my favorite restaurants to come to, however it has slowly declined. We were here on a relatively slow day and our service reflected that. It was painfully slow, took a very long time to get our food, have a server come to our table, etc. The food was mediocre, nothing special. I'm sad that it has gone downhill so much.

CPK in Smith Haven Mall is okay if you are looking for a chain restaurant where you can share some apps, small plates and all types of funky pizzas at a very reasonable price. We shared a chicken tinga quesadilla which is an item we used to love but has really gone down hill. We've noticed its decline over he last few visits but this time it was particularly disappointing since there was almost no chicken or beans in it at all. The dumplings were very good as was the jerk chicken pizza. What gets this review to a 4th star is our excellent server Kenny. He was so attentive and even reminded us how we didn't want bacon on our to go food since he remembered us ordering no bacon on our original order. Thanks again!

Had lunch here recently and the food was really good. The gluten free pizza was some of the best I've had. My boyfriend's meal was also really tasty, and the service was definitely good. Will be returning.

So I ended up coming back, as we were celebrating a friend'a birthday and this was her pick. I once again ordered a gluten free pie, and told the waitress I had some issues in the past.  When our food was delivered, the manager came over and told me she supervised the production of the pizza and to contact her if I had any issues.  The pizza this time was gluten free, but tasted MUCH different than the last time I was here, leading me to believe they gave me a regular pie last time.  In addition, we had a drink at the bar before our group arrived and their credit card machine went down, so the bartender added it to our food bill. Imagine my surprised when the charge showed up anyway on my bill. I called the store to have it resolved and it eventually was, but still annoying.  Overall I think their customer service seems to be improving but they have some ways to go.
I love coming here.... They have quite a few pizza selections. The California Club Pizza was sooo yummy!! The drinks were really good too! The server was very friendly. Can't wait to come back.

Pizza. Was never a fan of chain pizza joints, except pizzeria UNO. I loved them. I figured I'd try CPK and it was decent. I went back again a few times and again, it was OK. Service was ok and nothing great. The wife had a macaroni dish and I had the pizza that's full of meat. It def was better than the first pizza I had (name slips my mind at the moment). There was a long wait during the popular dinner times/days.   Try it, I'm curious to see what you have to say.

I like CPK a lot. Good pizza for a reasonable price. Service is good and fast. Pizza choices are plentiful and it won't break your budget. There was no wait on a Saturday night but the place was full. You can get an alcohol drink if you want. That's always a plus.
For the price they charge, their food is not worth it. The food taste like it is frozen and then heated up. Please beware.

I really like their pizzas.  The taste is just sensational and there are so many fun pizzas to choose from.  Their side salads also just fix my salad craving before I dig into the actual pizza.  We've experienced solid service, albeit our visit was not during peak hours.  My glass was consistently full and that's hard since most of my friends think I need a diet coke IV. The ambiance is nothing special but there are plenty of comfy booths and ample tables.  Some of their drink specials looked yummy but I haven't tried any yet.  My only complaint is that I find the pizzas can be pretty pricey.  So don't go in with the typical "pizza bill" in mind, it will likely be more.  That being said, they do use more gourmet type ingredients on some of their pizzas.  In total, I'm a fan!

We stopped by this place for lunch while doing some Halloween shopping at the mall. We started with the white corn guacamole. The guac was good but the chips were a little stale. I'd def order it again. For the entree we had the Sicilian thin crust, the poblano pepper, and the Hawaiian. The portion sizes were perfect and each platter tasted good. The service was prompt and friendly. Sure, it's a chain restaurant and us New Yorkers are a pretentious lot when it comes to pizza so most of the negative reviews here have no gravitas. CPK is worth a try.

Mediocre pizza, poor service. I expected a little more flavour and pizazz from my Hawaiian pizza, but got neither except for one awkward bite where it tasted like some hot sauce had been accidentally spilled. Fiancée's pear salad pizza seemed to be better, but the caramelized onions put her off a bit. But the service. This guy seemed to be in some kind of rush the whole time. There were plenty of empty tables, and none of the rest of the wait staff seemed to be in a rush. Our empty dishes weren't bussed right away, sometimes not at all. I had to remind the guy about my drink order. And as we are still eating he brings us over the check and says "Not to rush you guys...." I quickly asked for a dessert menu to stall for more time, and he brought it over and had to explain what his favourite dessert items were. And which ones he didn't like. Thanks, buddy. We skipped dessert and took our time getting out of there, because why rush? We're the ones paying.

Ordered small plate- arugula and asparagus salad... so much rotten salad. Had chile rellano, just got one, kinda small, flavor was okay. Restaurant was pretty empty, had to physically take my bill to the register.. service needs improvement.

Okay I am not one for themed pizza.  Growing up in New York, I never had to settle for less than average, chain pizza - thank the good lord.  I was totally hesitant to eat at California Pizza Kitchen, infact, I dead out refused to go, since I know I can get a good pie right around the corner from my house at the same price California PIzza Kitchen charges for an individual pie.   I was wrong, I said it.  One of the few times I will admit this - I am freaking hooked.  The Garlic Herb Roasted Chicken Pizza is DELICIOUS!!!!!!!!! I crave it!! This is not chain pizza, it is not New York pizza, but it is not chain pizza.  It doesn't taste like a cardboard box, it tastes like heaven! HA!  I have tried a few other pizzas, but will not stray from my favorite.  The wait staff is friendly, and their drinks are VERY good - try the appleberry sangria mmm!! The atmosphere is great, I like to eat my pizza at the bar in front of the open flame, brick oven! :)
I might be me but i am not a fan of their pizza. The pizzeria around that area is better and  has better deal.
Love this place. It's rarely crowded and the food and service are good. Recommend trying the spring roll appetizers.

This place completely sucks! One of the worst dining experiences. Our first time there and the food was mediocre, nothing special at all. The portion size was also ridiculously small and way over priced!  I can order "one" slice of REAL pizza elsewhere that is larger then their whole pie! And for only $1.75!!!  The pizzas here average $12-$15 each. Absolutely ridiculous!! The service was even more horrid!  Please don't waste your money like we did. Went there with my wife and we thought "let's try it". It was so not a good idea. They over charged us for a combo pizza. We told the waitress it was our first time, and she told us we could mix two half pizzas to make one pie if we wanted. No mention of an extra charge for that, so we ordered thinking it was a good way to try out what they have. The service was slow, and when the bill came out it was insane! They charged us almost double the price of one pizza for two half pizzas! The pizzas are already very pricey. After asking why it was so high, they said they charge extra for mixing two half pies to make one. Being that the waitress never told us that little tidbit of info, and knowing it was our first time, we thought they would just correct the mistake. Nope! she apologized and said she would talk to the manager. No manager in sight, she just comes back with another bill for the most expensive pizza we ordered! It wouldn't have been a problem except the other half pizza we ordered was the cheapest on the menu! How is that fair? The manager never made an appearance, the food was average, and the large bill for lame tasting pizza with shotty service left us completely disgusted. You have to understand that this place sells designer pizza, and they are charging for a special experience. I could make a lot better designer pizza at home, I'm completely serious. This place is a joke.
I've been to many CPKs cross the east coast and this one has the best service, the food is just as good. If you're looking for a casual meal this is a great place.

This is the dirtiest CPK I've ever been to. The flatware was dirty and so were the dishes. When I touched the table, I got something sticky on my hand. I've been to Chinese restaurants that were cleaner than this CPK. We ordered the avocado egg rolls, the Hawaiian Pizza, and the works pizza. The Hawaiian pizza was only luke warm at best. Customer service wise, the waiter only came by once to ask how we were doing and our waters were never refilled. Overall, I was not surprised that this CPK did not seem very busy. On a side note, they also seemed to want us to go, after declining the dessert menu, the waiter immediately brought the check...
i never had a problem here, the food and the wine is great. the waiters are dumb as fuck and not much mention for but never had to wait to long for a meal. well pull my pork i recommend it
Recently saw you can order take out from your I phone! Awesome I don't have to talk to anyone just send in my order. Awesome and the food is great. Even get a bottle of wine to take home. Love it.

my kids love it here, that is the only reason i have been back more than once. i always get the same thing either bbq chicken pizza or the thai chicken pizza.. it is adequate. large portions, decent price. its not the best, but then again its not the worst.

overall a very good dining experience. the menu is waaay more than pizza by the way if you didnt know.  anyways,  i had recommended CPK as an alternative to where my family wanted to go (Cheesecake Factory), so I was very glad the wait was as described. i wanted to write in specifically to say how impressed we all were with our waiter 'Jase'... the restaurant was very busy and was closing early being new years day.  He was extremely polite, friendly and patient (we changed our order and asked to re heat one item).  He definitely impressed our whole family with his demeanor and efficiency.  Thank you for a great experience.
Not a bad place.  I've been here a handful of times and the service is good.  Pretty upset they discontinued the buffalo chicken pizza, it was my staple menu item.
